intro: Mitracarpus villosus, commonly known as the hairy mitracarpus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are pinnately compound, with narrow, lance-shaped leaflets. Mitracarpus villosus is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its delicate appearance and fragrance.
